page.title: 13Local History 1
page.content: {King Arthur's Castle -}The castle is set in a magnificent position on the cliffs.It is administered by English Heritage, whose chairman is Lord Montague.Legend says that it is the Castle of King Arthur.It has many visitors each year from April to October.Admission:60p Adults,25p Children. {The Old Post Office -}This fourteenth century manor house was probably the manor of Trevena.In the early part of the last century letters were brought by foot messenger, from Camelford 6 miles away.In 1844 for fifty years the G.P.O used the house as a letter receiving office.In the summer there are visitors from all over the world. It is open from 1st April until 31st October.Admission:Adults 80p, Children 40p.(National Trust property).
